TITLE: Europe's finest al fresco dining spots for this summer
SUMMARY: Few experiences herald the joys of summer living like eating and drinking outdoors, or dining al fresco as Italians call it, literally "in the open air."

TITLE: New York City restaurant unveils $200 french fries
SUMMARY: Jerome Powell, this story's for you.

TITLE: When a woman stole his dog, this man didn't press charges. Instead, he's paying for her drug rehab
SUMMARY: Drug addiction sabotaged Brayden Morton for five years. During that span, he attempted to get clean of fentanyl 16 times before he was successful.

TITLE: The assassination of Haiti's president is the latest challenge for CNN Heroes serving their nation
SUMMARY: Before the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moise, CNN Heroes and their non-profits already faced significant challenges serving their communities. Yet they have found ways to step up and make Haiti a better place, often in the face of gang violence and a lack of resources.

TITLE: This restaurant owner spends his free time fixing old cars and donating them to people in need
SUMMARY: When Eliot Middleton was a little boy, he followed his father around everywhere, watching the talented mechanic carefully fix car after car.

TITLE: CNN reporter enters US base captured by the Taliban. See what she found
SUMMARY: A former US military base is now in the hands of the Taliban as the future of Afghanistan is unclear. CNN's Clarissa Ward reports exclusively from what remains of Combat Outpost Andar in Afghanistan's Ghazni province.

TITLE: Afghan journalists are 'absolutely petrified' amid the Taliban takeover
SUMMARY: As Taliban forces seize control in Afghanistan, global news outlets are struggling to stay safe and continue reporting. But local journalists could be at greater risk.

TITLE: At least 20 people killed when fuel tank explodes in Lebanon
SUMMARY: At least 20 people were killed and 79 injured in a fuel tank explosion in the Akkar region in northern Lebanon, the Lebanese Red Cross said on its Twitter account early on Sunday.

TITLE: BBC Russia correspondent calls her imminent expulsion 'shocking' and says she can never go back
SUMMARY: A BBC journalist working in Moscow said Saturday that she felt shocked she was being expelled from Russia and said she had been told she could never return to the country, in what her employer, the UK's public broadcaster, described as a "direct assault on media freedom."

TITLE: The US and Canada have a new dark sky park for stargazers to enjoy
SUMMARY: Amateur astronomers take note: There's a new dark sky place to see the stars.

TITLE: Audi unveils a shape-shifting concept car
SUMMARY: Audi's latest concept car, the Skysphere, will be able to drive itself, the company claims. But the real hook is that, as it changes from human driving to self-driving, the body of the Skysphere expands by 10 inches from end-to-end.

TITLE: TCS employs more than 500,000 people. It's ready to ditch office life in India
SUMMARY: In almost 40 years with Tata Consultancy Services, N. Ganapathy Subramaniam and his team hardly ever worked remotely.

TITLE: This $4.7 million racer could be Bugatti's last gas-powered supercar
SUMMARY: Bugatti announced that it will be making a production version of its concept car called the Bolide, an 1,800-horsepower, 16-cylinder track-only supercar with a top speed of over 300 miles per hour. And this will likely be the last gasoline-powered car the French automaker will build.

TITLE: The new $2.6 million Lamborghini Countach is a hybrid
SUMMARY: Lamborghini has unveiled a brand new $2.6 million supercar with a very familiar name: the Countach.

TITLE: Attacked, rejected and harassed: Asians around the world speak out on workplace discrimination
'Like the 1950s': Inside a community frozen in time
SUMMARY: Homesteads dotting a pastoral landscape, families living by lamplight and men in straw hats riding horse-drawn carriages -- the scenes in Jake Michaels' photographs could easily depict bygone times in the American Midwest. But not only do his pictures hail from the digital age, they were taken hundreds of miles away in Belize.

TITLE: Remember when Gwyneth Paltrow wore a red velvet suit?
SUMMARY: Remember when Gwyneth Paltrow turned up at the MTV Video Music Awards wearing a luxurious red velvet suit over an unbuttoned blue shirt, her blonde hair tucked behind her ears?

TITLE: Picasso artworks displayed in a Las Vegas restaurant could fetch over $100M
SUMMARY: Eleven Pablo Picasso artworks that were on display at a Las Vegas restaurant for over 20 years will hit the auction block this October, just two days before what would have been the artist's 140th birthday.

TITLE: 'Sex and the City' is back. But will the outfits be as good?
SUMMARY: Ever since HBO Max released the first promotional image from "Sex and the City" spinoff "And Just Like That..." in early July, fans and fashion obsessives have been dissecting the returning characters' looks, sans Kim Cattrall's Samantha.

TITLE: Maroon 5 singer opens the doors to his idyllic LA home
SUMMARY: Tucked between the Santa Monica Mountains and the Pacific Ocean sits Adam Levine and Behati Prinsloo's own private slice of serenity.

TITLE: Nearly 2 million lives were lost. Now divers search for remains
SUMMARY: As he slipped through the kelp forest to the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean, Kamau Sadiki's eyes hooked onto something resembling the item he and fellow divers had been searching for.

TITLE: Canada and New Zealand's reopening plans
SUMMARY: A new airport has been named the very best in the world. New Zealand says it will start to reopen its borders next year. And dolphins have returned to Lisbon waters.

TITLE: World's best airports for 2021 revealed
SUMMARY: For the first time in nearly a decade, Singapore's Changi Airport has lost its place at the top of Skytrax's annual ranking of the world's best airports at the World Airport Awards.

TITLE: UN fears for revered Christian site
SUMMARY: They're one greatest cultural and religious treasures not only in Ethiopia but also in Africa and in Christendom: the ancient rock-hewn churches of Lalibela.

TITLE: Second Nigerian 'Chibok girl' freed in a week seven years after abduction
SUMMARY: A second young woman abducted seven years ago from the town of Chibok by Boko Haram militants was freed this week, Borno state's governor has said.

TITLE: Chinese and Russian troops link up, but analysts point to differing aims
SUMMARY: Jets screamed across the sky and cannons boomed in China's northwestern on Friday, as 10,000 People's Liberation Army and Russian troops gave a live-fire finale to a week of military exercises touted by both countries as a new high in bilateral military relations.

TITLE: How non-binary TikTok creators are helping a generation find their style
SUMMARY: While up-and-coming gender-fluid and non-binary designers like Harris Reed and Ella Boucht have begun to make their mark, it's also no secret that the fashion establishment hasn't made much of an effort to design for non-binary people -- at least that's if the collection after collection of drab, supposedly "gender-fluid" beige hoodies and graphic tees is to judge by.

TITLE: Unapologetically unfiltered, Rick Owens is fashion's ultimate antagonist
SUMMARY: Paris-based designer Rick Owens has been called many things in his long career. An antihero, a goth, fashion's "prince of darkness." He's been labeled as such because of his proclivity for a largely noir, gray and ice-hued oeuvre, his deployment of pentagram motifs on underwear or elk antlers on furniture, and an overall aesthetic that is -- and he'd agree with this -- rapturously anti-establishment.

TITLE: Paris Fashion Week 2021: How to watch the Spring-Summer 2022 shows
SUMMARY: From September 27 to October 5, the streets of Paris will once again come alive with models, designers and editors as fashion week prepares to take over the capital. There are more than 100 brands on the official Paris Fashion Week schedule -- and while only around a third of designers are planning in-person shows, the event already stands in stark contrast to last season's entirely digital program.

TITLE: He lived alone on an island for 33 years. Then he did this
SUMMARY: For nearly 33 years he lived a hermit life on a beautiful island in the Mediterranean, where he was the sole inhabitant.

TITLE: The gigantic boat that can carry cruise ships
SUMMARY: Few man-made movable structures are larger than a modern cruise ship, but even those giants of the sea sometimes need someone to lend them a hand to get to port.

TITLE: The 'world's safest city' for 2021 named
SUMMARY: Safety has long been a paramount concern for travelers when it comes to deciding which destination to visit.

TITLE: Journalists Maria Ressa and Dmitry Muratov win Nobel Peace Prize
SUMMARY: • Live updates: Winners praised for defending freedom of expression

TITLE: Nobel winner Dmitry Muratov's newspaper has long been a thorn in Putin's side
SUMMARY: Russian investigative newspaper Novaya Gazeta — whose editor-in-chief Dmitry Muratov won the Nobel Peace Prize on Friday — built its reputation as an outpost of the free press in part for its fearless reporting on the conflict in Chechnya, the former breakaway region in southern Russia.

TITLE: Nobel winner Maria Ressa vows to fight for facts and the rule of law
SUMMARY: For journalist Maria Ressa, reporting the news has always been the priority. But the newly honored Nobel Peace Prize winner says she has been forced to "become the news" simply because of her determination to do the job properly and defend the rule of law.

TITLE: Analysis: Hong Kong prioritized opening to China over the rest of the world. Now it's in Covid limbo
SUMMARY: Almost two years into the Covid-19 pandemic, some of the world's major business hubs are reopening as travel restrictions relax and daily life resumes, from New York to London and Paris.

TITLE: Dog takes over public transport in Istanbul
SUMMARY: A stray street dog in Istanbul, Turkey, has been seen traveling on public transport for several months. CNN's Rosemary Church has more.

TITLE: India's $99 billion man is opening the country's first 7-Eleven
SUMMARY: India's richest man is bringing 7-Eleven to the country, adding the convenience store chain to a sprawling business empire that spans energy, chemicals, retail and telecommunications.

TITLE: Why a hand gesture has South Korean companies on edge
SUMMARY: It took three years for players to notice the "offensive" hand gesture lurking in one of South Korea's most popular multiplayer games.

TITLE: Hong Kong developer quits the stock market as Evergrande fallout spreads
SUMMARY: Chinese Estates Holdings plans to go private after its stock was slammed by fallout from the crisis at Evergrande.

TITLE: Buffett pal Charlie Munger is doubling down on Alibaba bet
SUMMARY: Charlie Munger, the 97-year old vice chairman of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway, has long been bullish on China's economy. Now, Munger is putting more of his own firm's money into one of China's most well-known stocks: Alibaba.

TITLE: 'The bar is always in full swing': Kirsten Dunst opens doors to her ranch home
SUMMARY: With references to her career-defining roles and smatterings of family heirlooms, the personal touches throughout Dunst's 1930s ranch house make it more than just a beautiful space.

TITLE: Playboy features first openly gay man on cover
SUMMARY: Bretman Rock has donned Playboy's famed bunny ears and become the first out gay man to star on its cover.

TITLE: World's best restaurant for 2021 revealed
SUMMARY: The gentle clink of glasses, the low hum of conversation, the soft lights and appetite-whetting scents.

TITLE: First class is vanishing. Here's what's next
SUMMARY: After a long, golden sunset of being installed on fewer and fewer aircraft, the retirement of older aircraft caused by the Covid-19 pandemic means that when air travel resumes, international first class will be very nearly a thing of the past.

TITLE: Credit card packs in $1,148 of value
Card launches with unlimited 2% cash rewards on purchases

SUMMARY: A federal judge in Nevada has recommended that the rape case involving Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo be dismissed.

TITLE: Dramatic images show Hong Kong scaffolding collapse
SUMMARY: One person has died after a large scaffolding collapse in Hong Kong in the city's Happy Valley residential area, according to the public broadcaster RTHK.

TITLE: Inside Turkey's extraordinary underground city
SUMMARY: It's a landscape that looks almost alien. Soft tufa rock -- spewed from volcanoes millennia ago to create a series of ethereal "fairy chimneys" that have been shaped and sculpted by nature. This is Cappadocia.

TITLE: Plans unveiled for high-tech '10-minute city' in Seoul
SUMMARY: The idea of a "15-minute city," in which residents can all reach work and leisure facilities within a quarter-hour walk -- or cycle -- of their homes, has gained significant traction among urban planners during the Covid-19 pandemic.

TITLE: Hong Kong's flagship airline says strict new quarantine rules could cause 'dramatic' supply chain disruptions
SUMMARY: Hong Kong's flagship airline warned Friday that strict new quarantine measures in the city could lead to "dramatic disruptions" to local supply chains, as the company is forced to curb some passenger and cargo flights.

TITLE: China's Xi'an lockdown hits some of the world's largest chipmakers
SUMMARY: Two of the world's biggest chipmakers are warning that Covid-19 outbreaks and stringent lockdowns in a major Chinese industrial hub are hampering their operations.

TITLE: The cultural moments that defined 2021
SUMMARY: Year two of the pandemic was, in many ways, just as challenging and weird as the first.

SUMMARY: After a year of awkwardly Zoomed-in awards show speeches and tie dye hoodies, it's been a relief to see stars returning to the red carpet. Glamour came back with a vengeance, filling our feeds with color, sparkle and flashes of nostalgia.

SUMMARY: The spire of a soaring 118-story skyscraper has topped out at over 2,227 feet above Malaysia's capital, Kuala Lumpur.

TITLE: The beautiful hidden valley in the heart of Europe
SUMMARY: It's less than an hour's drive from Slovenia's capital, Ljubljana, yet the Vipava Valley hasn't really registered on the tourist radar.

TITLE: 20 astonishing facts about the A380 superjumbo
SUMMARY: Beloved by passengers for its spaciousness and comfort, but disliked by airlines because of its running costs, the Airbus A380 has already entered its sunset years, even though it debuted commercially just 14 years ago.

TITLE: Germany's airport of the future can't shake its curse
SUMMARY: After nearly a decade of delays and billions of euros over budget, Berlin's long-awaited airport, Berlin-Brandenburg, finally opened on October 31, 2020.

TITLE: They bought a cheap house in Italy. Here's what they learned
SUMMARY: Buying a cheap property in Italy is an attractive prospect for many travelers, particularly with the ever-growing number of towns offering up homes for next to nothing through regeneration schemes.
